newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU says probes Castle Tower's transmission buy.
newsitem.headline: EU says probes Castle Tower's transmission buy.

text.p: The European Commission said on Friday it was starting a routine probe into the purchase by a consortium led by Castle Tower Corporation of Houston, Texas, of the BBC's domestic television and radio transmission business.
"Upon preliminary examination, the Commission finds that the notified concentration could fall within the scope of (the EU merger regulation)," the Commission said in a statement.

Castle Tower is the managing partner in a consortium which includes Telediffusion de France, a subsidiary of the France Telecom Group, along with investment partners Candover Investments Plc and Berkshire Partners.
The BBC and the CTC consortium said on January 3 they expected to sign a contract for the sale, which analysts estimate could raise up to 200 million pounds, by the end of the month.
The consortium will get a 10-year contract to transmit BBC domestic analogue television and radio services.
The Commission has one month to clear the deal or start an in-depth probe if it is concerned about the impact on competition.
